main event: An unidentified flying light was observed over Los Alamos, New Mexico on 8th March 1949 at 1835 hours by various sources, including Kirtland Air Force Base control tower and Los Alamos guard stations.
interesting points: The observed object was described as having intense white light with a slight bluish tint and greenish-white in color.
It appeared elliptical, pointed at each end, and had an apparent size of 1/4 the size of the Sun.
At an altitude of 12,000 - 15,000 feet, it was seen descending at a 45Â° angle at a speed slower than a meteor.
Witnesses reported seeing a billowy white flaming tail, and the object appeared to be flaming or self-luminous.
The object disappeared behind cloud cover and seemed to parallel the mountain range.
witnesses: Kirtland Air Force Base control tower, Los Alamos guard stations
